alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb; Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 29 at 11:37PM EST until December 30 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN CHEROKEE...FORSYTH...NORTHERN COBB AND NORTHEASTERN FULTON COUNTIES... At 1137 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ducktown to near Alpharetta to near White Water Park, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Cumming, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Milton, Kennesaw, Acworth, Free Home, Drew, Kennesaw State University, Coal Mountain, Brookwood, Birmingham, Matt, Chestatee, Oscarville, Sandy Plains and Holbrook. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for north central and northwestern Georgia. A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure, such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
